FuncDef: The display bgp routing-table command displays related information about BGP routes.
CLIs: display bgp routing-table statistics [ active ]
display bgp routing-table <ipv4-address> { <mask-length> | <mask-ipv4> }
display bgp routing-table statistics cidr
display bgp routing-table statistics different-origin-as
display bgp routing-table statistics as-path-filter { <as-path-filter-num> | <as-path-filter-name> }
display bgp routing-table statistics community-filter { <basic-community-filter-number> | <advanced-community-filter-number> }
display bgp routing-table statistics community-filter <community-filter-name>
display bgp routing-table community-filter { <basic-community-filter-number> | <advanced-community-filter-number> }
display bgp routing-table community-filter <community-filter-name>
display bgp routing-table community [ <community-number> | <aa:nn> | internet | no-advertise | no-export | no-export-subconfed ] &<1-33>
display bgp routing-table community [ <community-number> | <aa:nn> | internet | no-advertise | no-export | no-export-subconfed ] &<1-33> whole-match
display bgp routing-table statistics community [ <community-number> | <aa:nn> | internet | no-advertise | no-export | no-export-subconfed ] &<1-33>
display bgp routing-table statistics community [ <community-number> | <aa:nn> | internet | no-advertise | no-export | no-export-subconfed ] &<1-33> whole-match
display bgp routing-table statistics regular-expression <as-regular-expression>
display bgp routing-table <ipv4-address> { <mask-length> | <mask-ipv4> } longer-prefixes
display bgp routing-table community-filter <basic-community-filter-number> whole-match
display bgp routing-table community-filter <community-filter-name> whole-match
display bgp routing-table statistics community-filter <basic-community-filter-number> whole-match
display bgp routing-table statistics community-filter <community-filter-name> whole-match
display bgp routing-table label statistics
display bgp routing-table extcommunity [ { rt | soo } <strExtCommunity> ] &<1-33>
display bgp routing-table extcommunity [ { rt | soo } <strExtCommunity> ] &<1-33> match-any
display bgp routing-table extcommunity-filter { <basic-extcomm-filter-number> | <advanced-extcomm-filter-number> }
display bgp routing-table extcommunity-filter <extcomm-filter-name>
display bgp routing-table statistics extcommunity [ { rt | soo } <strExtCommunity> ] &<1-33>
display bgp routing-table statistics extcommunity [ { rt | soo } <strExtCommunity> ] &<1-33> match-any
display bgp routing-table statistics extcommunity-filter { <basic-extcomm-filter-number> | <advanced-extcomm-filter-number> }
display bgp routing-table statistics extcommunity-filter <extcomm-filter-name>
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics [ active ]
display bgp labeled routing-table <ipv4-address> { <mask-length> | <mask-ipv4> }
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics cidr
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics different-origin-as
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics as-path-filter { <as-path-filter-num> | <as-path-filter-name> }
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics community-filter { <basic-community-filter-number> | <advanced-community-filter-number> }
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics community-filter <community-filter-name>
display bgp labeled routing-table community-filter { <basic-community-filter-number> | <advanced-community-filter-number> }
display bgp labeled routing-table community-filter <community-filter-name>
display bgp labeled routing-table community [ <community-number> | <aa:nn> | internet | no-advertise | no-export | no-export-subconfed ] &<1-33>
display bgp labeled routing-table community [ <community-number> | <aa:nn> | internet | no-advertise | no-export | no-export-subconfed ] &<1-33> whole-match
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics community [ <community-number> | <aa:nn> | internet | no-advertise | no-export | no-export-subconfed ] &<1-33>
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics community [ <community-number> | <aa:nn> | internet | no-advertise | no-export | no-export-subconfed ] &<1-33> whole-match
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics regular-expression <as-regular-expression>
display bgp labeled routing-table <ipv4-address> { <mask-length> | <mask-ipv4> } longer-prefixes
display bgp labeled routing-table community-filter <basic-community-filter-number> whole-match
display bgp labeled routing-table community-filter <community-filter-name> whole-match
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics community-filter <basic-community-filter-number> whole-match
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics community-filter <community-filter-name> whole-match
display bgp labeled routing-table label statistics
display bgp labeled routing-table extcommunity [ { rt | soo } <strExtCommunity> ] &<1-33>
display bgp labeled routing-table extcommunity [ { rt | soo } <strExtCommunity> ] &<1-33> match-any
display bgp labeled routing-table extcommunity-filter { <basic-extcomm-filter-number> | <advanced-extcomm-filter-number> }
display bgp labeled routing-table extcommunity-filter <extcomm-filter-name>
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics extcommunity [ { rt | soo } <strExtCommunity> ] &<1-33>
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics extcommunity [ { rt | soo } <strExtCommunity> ] &<1-33> match-any
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics extcommunity-filter { <basic-extcomm-filter-number> | <advanced-extcomm-filter-number> }
display bgp labeled routing-table statistics extcommunity-filter <extcomm-filter-name>

ParaDef.Info:
Displays statistics about active routes.
-

Specifies an IPv4 address of destination.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of an IPv4 address.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

Specifies the mask of an IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays statistics about BGP routes.
-

Displays classless inter-domain routing (CIDR) information.
-

Displays routes that have the same destination address but different source AS numbers.
-

Specifies the number of an AS_Path filter.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 256.

Specifies the name of the matching AS_Path filter.
-

Specifies the number of a basic community filter.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 99.

Specifies the number of an advanced community filter.
The value is an integer ranging from 100 to 199.

Specifies the name of a community filter.
The value is a string of 1 to 51 case-sensitive characters. The string cannot be all digits.

Specify community number.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Specify aa<0-65535>:nn <0-65535>.
The value is a string of 1 to 11 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Displays the BGP public network routes carrying the internet community attribute.
-

Displays the BGP public network routes carrying the No-Advertise community attribute.
-

Displays the BGP public network routes carrying the No-Export community attribute.
-

Displays the BGP public network routes carrying the No-Export-Subconfed community attribute.
-

Indicates exact matching.
-

Specifies the regular expression that AS_Path matched.
The value is a string of 1 to 80 characters.

Matches according to the mask longer than the specified length.
-

Displays the labeled routes in the BGP routing table.
-

Displays information about BGP routes with a specified extended community attribute.
-

Displays information about IPv4 routes with the route target (RT) extended community attribute.
-

Displays information about IPv4 routes with the source of origin (SoO) extended community attribute.
-

Specifies the excommunity value. IP<X.X.X.X>:NN<0-65535> or AS<0-65535>:NN<0-4294967295> or AS<65536-4294967295>:NN<0-65535> or AS<0-65535>.<0-65535>:NN<0-65535>.
The attribute is a BGP extended community attribute and can be expressed in any of the following formats:
2-byte AS number:4-byte user-defined number, for example, 1:3. The AS number ranges from 0 to 65535, and the user-defined number ranges from 0 to 4294967295. The AS number and user-defined number cannot both be set to 0. Specifically, the value of the SoO attribute cannot be 0:0.IPv4-address:2-byte user-defined number, for example, 192.168.122.15:1. The IP address ranges from 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255, and the user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535.Integral 4-byte AS number:2-byte user-defined number, for example, 0:3 or 65537:3. An AS number ranges from 65536 to 4294967295. A user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535. The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. Specifically, the value of the SoO attribute cannot be 0:0.4-byte AS number in dotted notation:2-byte user-defined number, for example, 0.0:3 or 0.1:0. A 4-byte AS number in dotted notation is in the format of x.y, where x and y are integers ranging from 1 to 65535 and from 0 to 65535, respectively. A user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535. The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. Specifically, the value of the SoO attribute cannot be 0.0:0.

Displays information about IPv4 routes with any of the specified extended community attributes.
-

Specifies the name of an extcommunity filter.
The value is a string of 1 to 51 characters.

Specifies the number of an extcommunity filter.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 199.

Specifies the number of an advanced extcommunity filter.
The value is an integer ranging from 200 to 399.

Indicates the routing-table is in the BGP labeled address family.
-

Examples: Total Number of Prefix Advertised to RM : 0
Status codes: * - valid, > - best, d - damped, x - best external, a - add path,
h - history,  i - internal, s - suppressed, S - Stale
Origin : i - IGP, e - EGP, ? - incomplete
RPKI validation codes: V - valid, I - invalid, N - not-found
Network            NextHop        MED        LocPrf    PrefVal ExtCommunity
Status codes: * - valid, > - best, d - damped, x - best external, a - add path,
h - history,  i - internal, s - suppressed, S - Stale
Origin : i - IGP, e - EGP, ? - incomplete
RPKI validation codes: V - valid, I - invalid, N - not-found
Network            NextHop        MED        LocPrf    PrefVal Community
Paths:   1 available, 1 best, 1 select, 0 best-external, 0 add-path
BGP routing table entry information of 10.1.1.1/32:
AS-path Nil, origin incomplete, MED 33, localpref 100, pref-val 0, valid, internal, best, select, pre 255, IGP cost 10
Not advertised to any peer yet
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view the information about routes in the BGP routing table, run the display bgp routing-table command with specified parameters.
Precautions
During route flapping, the route statistics may differ from the actual number of routes on the network because some routes are still on the way.
